text: GRAY SURFACE FILLS THE SCREEN.  At first it's hard to  recognize this rough, indistinct surface.  But when a CHI HAND drags a piece of colored chalk ACROSS THE FRAME, we  realize that we're seeing a very close view of a CONCRETE WALKWAY.

A SERIES OF CLOSE SHOTS FOLLOW THE MOVEMENTS of the tiny as it proceeds to lay out an intricate CHALK DRAWING on t walkway. For a while, we are too close to identify the image that being created.  But as THE CAMERA PULLS BACK, we see a  youthful artist's representation of a two story HOUSE. The CAMERA TILTS UP, revealing a LITTLE GIRL in white dre She's holding a handful of colored chalk.  Behind her sit the ELM STREET HOUSE. As the TITLES END, we...

The trees lining this residential street are bare, and th sway in the breeze that's blowing their dead leaves acros the sidewalk. KRISTEN, a beautiful, but pensive-looking blonde teenager walking slowly towards the ominous house.  Although her f shows signs of fear, she is moving with resolve.

Kristen stops and looks down at the angelic little girl w has been creating the childish drawing of Freddy's house. Kneeling down beside her, Kristen takes a closer look at colorful chalk sketch. It has an almost exaggerated cheerfulness.  And although  awkwardly rendered, it makes the house look new, and the well-tended.  The idyllic sidewalk illustration looks not like its subject, which has peeling paint, boarded-up  windows, and is horribly run-down.
(looking up)
Hello...
Do you live here?
(sadly)
Nobody lives here.
Where's Freddy?
(giggles strangely)

He's not home. Just then, the child lifts her hand away from the picture What Kristen sees makes her gasp.  A crudely drawn, but  easily recognizable image of FREDDY KRUEGER is visible be one of the windows. There is a CRACK of LIGHTNING, and drops of rain start to sprinkle down on to the girl and her drawing.

Kristen glances up at the sky.  Rain trickles onto her fa Then after a second, she looks back down at the sidewalk. THE LITTLE GIRL IS GONE.  Kristen scans the area, but the child is nowhere to be seen. Rain is splashing down on the chalk illustration. Not onl the image washing away, but as the colors blend together, they form a liquid that looks just like BLOOD. Kristen hears a CREAKING NOISE coming from the direction the house.  She turns and stares at the menacing structur The front door is SLOWLY OPENING.  Somehow Kristen seems  unsurprised by this.  And as though drawn by an  uncontrollable urge, she turns toward the house.  With  thunder and lightning crashing above her, she walks  deliberately toward the open door.
As soon as Kristen enters the house, she hears VOICES beh her.  It's CHILDREN SINGING a strange nursery rhyme.
One two, Freddy's coming for you... Kristen spins around and looks back through the open door
standing out in the yard that was empty a moment before a dozen very young CHILDREN.  Dressed in their Sunday best, they are staring at Kristen as they continue to sing:
Three four, better lock the door...

The front door SLAMS SHUT with a bang.  Kristen's determi expression dissolves, and she reaches back for the doorkn It turns without resistance and the door opens with ease. Kristen rushes through the doorway, but instead of findin herself outside, she is in...

Kristen's eyes widen as she compares her surroundings wit the dusty, decaying room that is visible on the other sid the still-open door.  They are exactly the same. Before she can take another step, the door slams shut aga And this time when she tries to open it, it's locked soli
(muttering)
Calm and cool, I'm calm and cool... She moves down the hall, finds an open door, steps throug

Kristen walks in, the old floorboards creaking under her  feet.  She looks at the walls.  They are lined with eerie paintings of children playing in graveyards.  Rainwater d down from the ceiling. When FLASHES OF LIGHTNING illuminate the room, Kristen  catches sights of an old and dusty couch in one corner. couch with a distinctive RED AND GREEN STRIPED LINING. Another bolt FLASHES.  Kristen is horrified to see,  silhouetted on one of the walls, the shadow of a hand wit long, knife-like fingers. So frightened that she can barely breathe, Kristen turns the LARGE WINDOW across the room.   ANOTHER FLASH lights up the dark room, and Kristen relaxe It isn't Freddy outside the window.  It's only a tree bra Relieved, Kristen starts over toward the window.  But bef she reaches it, there is a sudden, massive CLAP OF THUNDE and the entire window EXPLODES into the room. A huge gust of WIND roars in through the shattered window and blows Kristen off her feet.

Kristen tumbles down a set of heavy metal chute that has appeared out of nowhere, and lands on the concrete floor very large, dark Boiler Room.  She scrambles to her feet looks around, terrified like a trapped animal.
(under her breath)
He's not here, he's dead.  He's not here,  he's dead.  He's... Just then, Kristen hears the unmistakable SOUND of Freddy knives scraping against a nearby metal surface. KRISTEN (cont'd) (crying out)
No!!  Kincaide!  Joey!  Help me!!

Kincaid is sitting at his desk, his head drooped down ove open copy of an illustrated sports magazine.  A harmless- looking MONGREL is sleeping at his feet. Suddenly, Kincaid's chair BEGINS TO SHAKE.  He lifts his in surprise just as he suddenly flies from the chair and  sails through the air, straight towards a wall in his roo But instead of piling into the solid surface, Kincaid sai right through it and DISAPPEARS into the void.

Kincaid falls into the Boiler Room, crashing through a pi of rusty pipes and boilers.  As soon as he catches his  breath, he looks up and sees Kristen.  He quickly jumps t his feet and starts to yell at his friend.

Awww shit, Kristen, not again.... Kristen motions for Kincaid to LISTEN as the SCREECHING  continues.   Kincaid, unimpressed, shows Kristen that it's merely the  metal arature of a boiler attachment SCRAPING against a  railing. KINCAID (cont'd)
You are one spooked chick... Before Kincaid can say another word, Kristen holds up her hand.  FOOTSTEPS are echoing out of the shadows behind th

Shh... They both spin around just as a FIGURE lurches toward the Kincaid gasps, and Kristen screams.  But a moment later t each let out big sighs.  It's JOEY.  Kincaid covers his f with cool nonchalance. KRISTEN (cont'd)
Joey, thank God!!  I thought...
Thought what?  Of dragging us in here?
Yeah, cut it out.  You're puttin' a dent  in my beauty sleep. They both glare at Kristen.  They're pissed.
(in a halting voice)
It's Freddy... He's here.  I heard him.
Chill out, Kristen...Freddy's dead,  buried, and consecrated.  We won,  remember?
(shaking her head)
He's back... to get us.
Now way, Kincaid's right, Fred Krueger is  history, c'mere... He leads her around the Boiler Room.  He makes her touch  pipes, and then positions her in front of the large furna JOEY (cont'd)

Look... The pipes are cold, the boiler is  cold... see for yourself. He swings open the iron door on the furnace.  Kristen mov close to look in the black void.  There isn't even the gl of an ember inside.  She turns away.

I don't know... ALL AT ONCE, a howling BEAST leaps out of the furnace.  I Kincaid's dog.  Kristen has managed to pull it into her d with its master. The terrified animal clamps its jaws around Kristen's arm and knocks the screaming girl down to the floor.
Joey wakes up with a start, and tries to re-orient himsel His sudden movements cause his waterbed to slosh back and forth like crazy.

Kincaid jerks his head up off his desk, and glances aroun his room with an expression of relief.  Then he hears a  WHIMPERING sound and looks down. His dog is staring up at him with uncomprehending eyes.   There is BLOOD around the animal's mouth.

Kristen throws her covers off and jumps up out of bed.  S breathing hard and her arm is BLEEDING.  Grabbing a T-shi off a chair, Kristen wraps it around the wound. She sits back down on her bed. She looks really scared.

The morning sun is rising behind the broad-limbed trees t shade a collection of unassuming homes.  It's a peaceful  neighborhood.  Just the kind that Freddy used to like. A girl pulls up in front of one house.  She's driving a V Rabbit Convertible. It's Kristen.  She wears a long sleeve shirt, but a bulge reveals where her arm is bandaged.

Kristen quickly walks to the side door of a modest house. After ringing the bell, she glances out at the sidewalk. Kristen turns back, a STERN-LOOKING MAN is standing in th open doorway.  Although probably not much over forty, DEN JOHNSON'S face shows a lot of wear; too much scotch, too work.  He's dressed for work and is preparing to leave, b his hangover is self-evident.
How are you, Mr. Johnson? Johnson ignores her. KRISTEN (cont'd)

That's nice. Johnson turns away.  His daughter ALICE shows up at the d slinking warily by her father.  In a definite contrast to Kristen's easy beauty, Alice is not especially well put  together.  And yet there's something about this shy-looki girl that suggests that she might be incredibly attractiv she had any confidence.
(low)
Hi, Kristen...Rick'll be out any second. Kristen looks in the doorway at Johnson who is holding a  tomato-juice and spices hangover delight.  Kristen makes face.  Alice turns as Johnson looks up.
(to Alice)
You going out dressed like that?
(defensive)
What's wrong with me this time?
(embarrassed)
Uhh, I'll just wait outside.

No, it's okay.  Maybe you can help her. Johnson pours a shot of Vodka into his morning concoction SLAMS the door shut, leaving the two girls alone on the f porch.  Kristen is about to console Alice when they HEAR RUSTLING sound above them.  RICK, Alice's brother, is  shimmying out of an upper floor window. He reaches for a nearby tree, and with surprising grace h maneuvers to the ground and lands smiling in front of the girls.  He gives Kristen a quick kiss.
Something wrong with the stairs?
Avoid-all-contact-day.
What?
When dad's popping aspiring like popcorn,  it's avoid-all-contact-day. Johnson suddenly reopens the door and reaches for the mor newspaper.  He stares at the kids.
Waiting for a limo? Rick grabs his father's face and gives him a big, noisy k on the cheek.
(mock Ricky Ricardo)
Okay, honey.  I'm off to the club! The girls chuckle as Johnson becomes embarrassed and SLAM the door on the kids.

Springwood High doesn't look particularly inviting, but h many high schools do?  STUDENTS are arriving on foot, on  bikes, and in a variety of motor vehicles. Kristen, Rick and Alice pull up in Kristen's VW Rabbit  Convertible and park.  They step onto the sidewalk and cr along beside the STUDENT PARKING LOT.  They stop beside a ATTRACTIVE GIRL who is leaning against a car, listening t the blasting radio inside. The girl, DEBBIE STEVENS, is one well put together item. tough but smart girl from the wrong side of the tracks,  trying to compensate for her roots with defensive spunk,  sexy, and she knows it.
Alright, anybody have trig this semester? Alice, Rick and Kristen shake their heads 'no'.
What happened?
I had a conflict.  Homework or Dynasty.   Dynasty won.
A sad story.  Those soaps'll kill ya. Alice's attention drifts to a tough PICK-UP that is pulli up not far from them.  A handsome, dark-haired TEENAGER, climbs out of the car. Debbie eyes him too.
(appreciative)
There's Dan Jordan.  Mmmmm, we're talkin'  major league fox.
Begin DAYDREAM. JUMP CUT to Dan standing directly in front of Alice.  She in a more confident, seductive pose.  She looks him up an down and flashes a Lauren Bacall smile.
Mmmmmm, you know, you are one major  league fox. She puts a hand on Dan's waist.  He grows nervous and  awkward, as if he's the shy one now.
(stammers)
T-T-Thanks Alice...
Earth to Alice... Alice snaps out of it.  Dan is suddenly back where he was walking away with a group of his friends. RICK (cont'd)
You spacing again?
(hush-hush)
Rick, please.

Alright, I think I see salvation... A battered and sputtering VESPA SCOOTER is zipping toward them through the parking lot.  The BLACK GIRL riding the  scooter looks a bit nerdy, with thick glasses and short h but makes up for it with a hip sense of style.  Her scoot has been souped up with a few home-made gadgets and  attachments. As soon as SHEILA KOPECKY reaches them, she hops off her  bike, and unstraps the pile of books and papers from the  back.  Tons of SMOKE pour out the back of it. DEBBIE (cont'd) (bats smoke away)
How can you ride that health hazard?   It's no wonder you have asthma.
Asthma is an inherited condition.  If you  read a book now and then, you might know  something.
Speaking of books, isn't trig your  favorite? Sheila stares at Debbie a beat.
Dynasty again, huh?  Girl, get a VCR. Sheila pulls out her asthma inhaler and sticks it in her  mouth.  She takes a few puffs.  A cocky, obnoxious BLACK walks by and comments to Sheila.
Yo, baby, you're sucking on the wrong  nozzle. Sheila is embarrassed and falls short of managing a retor Debbie steps in between Sheila and the jock and does it f her.

Hey, needledick.  I bet you're the only  male in this school suffering from penis  envy. The jock stares in confusion, not quite understanding the insult.  Our group cracks up and pats Debbie on the shoul as the jock walks off.

Alright, I owe you one. Debbie suddenly stops laughing and lets out a disgusted G A huge ROACH is crawling around her books.  She shakes th book until the bug falls off, then grinds it under her fo a little too enthusiastically.
Supergirl, I think it's dead. The group gets their stuff together and heads for class.

STUDENTS are moving through the hallway that cuts through center of Springwood High. Kristen is standing against one wall, spinning the dial o her locker.  Rick can be seen a dozen lockers down from h Kristen gets the locker open, grabs a couple of her books then slams it shut.  But as the locker door swings away, SUDDENLY REVEALS the faces of Kincaid and Joey just inche from Kristen.  They startle the hell out of her.
Hi...guys.
Hi guys?!?  Hi guys?!?!  That's all you  got to say after last night? Kristen studies her two angry friends for a moment, then  speaks up in a firm voice.
I'm telling you, he's coming back! He tries to move around, but bumps his head on something

Yo open this sucker up!! He pounds on the metal above. It moves just enough to rev a thin crack of blue light.  He continues to mutter to  himself in confusion. He pounds a few more times, starting to panic, when the m above his head finally pops open.
Kincaid sticks his head out of the trunk of a wrecked car looks around.  He's in an ominous auto graveyard.
This ain't my dreamland.  KRISTEN.  IF

head_text.subj: YOU HERE I'M GONNA POUND YOUR ASS

text: Kincaid looks around.  No one's to be seen. KINCAID (cont'd) (calling)
Kristen!!  Hey, Kristen!! (beat, then sheepishly)
Kristen? He collects himself and puts on a badass walking gait.  W he hears a low GROWLING, Kincaid looks down.  A few feet from him is his dog.  It has an odd expression on its fac KINCAID (cont'd)
Jason? (relaxes, becomes sympathetic)
Listen little sister, we know you got  this talent for bringing folks into your  dreams, but we don't need it anymore.   Time to live like regular people.
Let it rest. 'Sides, who knows, you might  stir him back up if you keep going in.   Kincaid and I'll help, we're still a  team, and we ALL have better things to  dream about.
You got that right, signed and sealed. Kristen wants to believe, but she can't, because:
Then what about this? Kristen pulls up her sleeve, and reveals the blood-staine bandage on her forearm.
That don't mean dick.  My dog's like me.   Drag him into a crazy dream and he gets  wild. The guys see Rick approaching. KINCAID (cont'd) (jokingly, trying to change the  subject)
Here comes your boyfriend.  Can't he give  you a good night's sleep? Rick arrives in time to hear Kincaid's comment.
We don't kiss and tell.  How 'bout you  guys? Kincaide starts to mount a comeback, but Joey pulls him a Kristen watches them disappear into the crowd. RICK (cont'd)
Those guys are kind of spooky.
Then you must think I'm a total freak. Rick ponders this.
I go back and forth. Kristen is not amused. RICK (cont'd)
Lighten up.  No one died. Rick strokes her cheek.  Kristen forces a weak smile.

Kincaid is getting into bed.  His night time attire consi of a T-shirt and a pair of sweat pants. As the sleepy young man settles between the sheets, a FOR begins to slowly open the door behind him.  It SQUEAKS as inches open.  Kincaid is on alert.  After a few moments o suspense, Kincaid's mangy dog shoves the door the rest of way open, and trots into the room. The mutt hops up onto the bed and circles a couple of tim When it finally lies down, Kincaid shoves it over a bit.
Come on, Jason, move over. The dog and his master adjust their positions, then Kinca reaches over and turns off the light.
His eyes slowly shut.  The room is still.  But suddenly a SCREECHING SOUND wakes him.
Kincaid opens his eyes.  It's too dark for him to see muc so he reaches for the light on his bedstand.  But instead finding a lamp, his hand slams against a metal surface.

The dog is furiously digging below the back of an imposin looking OLD CADILLAC.  Some strange instinct seems to hav overpowered the animal.  The boy rushes forward and tries to stop his dog.  But it no longer acting like a friendly pet, and it turns and sn at him viciously. Kincaid stops and stares in disbelief as the dog lifts it leg and PISSES FIRE onto the spot where it's been digging A FLAMING STREAM runs along the ground, and a moment late the earth RUMBLES and starts to CRACK OPEN along this lin fire.  Shafts of light erupt out of the crack. Its job complete, the dog howls and runs off into the nig Kincaid watches it disappear between the stacks of cars, steps forward and looks down into the SMOLDERING PIT.

Down at the bottom of this freshly formed crevice, a pile BONES is forming itself into a HUMAN SKELETON.  They clic together like a machine gun put together by an experience soldier.   And as if that isn't creepy enough, a body is quickly  REGENERATING. FLESH appears on the bones.  Cartilage knits the joints, muscle swells within the OOZING TISSUE that is forming al over the body.  It's the antithesis of decomposition. When BURNED SKIN forms over the flesh, and clothes revers their rot and cover the skin, there is no longer any doub who's rebirth we are witnessing.

Kincaid watches in horror as the sinister figure rises fr the grave.  FREDDY'S BACK. Freddy raises his right hand, and with a flick of his wri extends the long shiny BLADES at the ends of the fingers  (like switch blades.).

You shouldn't've buried me...I'm not  dead. Kincaid doesn't hesitate for another second.  Before Fred even starts to move toward him, the terrified dreamer tur and runs.  He finds the opening where he entered, and mad squeezes himself back through it.

Kincaid starts to weave his way through the maze of piled cars. He turns a corner and pauses to catch his breath.  He loo around.  There's no sign of Freddy.  Breathing hard, he t around at the piles of cars around him.  The expression o his face tells us he's got an idea.
He round the corner and stops, there's no Kincaid.  He lo around, confused.  He HEARS the SQUEAK of metal.

Who's on top of a pile of cars.  He's straining with his  super dream-strength to push the top car off the pile.  H succeeds. The car topples down onto Freddy, squashing him flat.  A  victorious Kincaid jumps down onto the roof, then hood of car.

Take that, mutha-fucker! Kincaide jumps to the ground.  As soon as he lands, the c around him go wild.  HORNS HONK, lights flash, windshield wipers wipe. Suddenly before Kincaid can react, cars start to pile in  around him.  He spins around to watch as he is quickly bo in by piles of cars which come crashing in. Kincaid is boxed in like a trapped mouse.  The HORNS on t cars around him HONK and headlights flash at him.  There is no way out.  He's completely trapped in a space much larger than a single car. Suddenly, Kincaid hears a SCRAPING NOISE right behind him Freddy's claws are SCRAPING a windshield. He spins around, and finds FREDDY standing just inches aw with his knives raised. Freddy brings his blades down and jams them into Kincaid' chest. KINCAID (cont'd) (gurgling)
Kiss my ass, I'll see you in hell...
(smiling)

Tell them Freddy sent ya!! HAHAHAHA! Freddy pushes the knives farther and farther into Kincaid The tips of the sharp blades POP out of the center of  Kincaid's back.  ONE AT A TIME, ACCENTED BY CRUEL SOUND F FREDDY (cont'd)
One down...two to go...hahahah!

Kincaid's eyes shoot open and he clutches his chest in ag His dog wakes and nuzzles up to his dying master, but the is oblivious to the dog's tender attention. With his final breath, Kincaid tries unsuccessfully to ca out Kristen's name.

Kristen is sitting in bed with her knees drawn to her che Holding her breath, she's listening.  The room is silent. must have been the wind tickling the chimes outside her  window that drew her attention. She sighs, and reaches for the can of hi-caf Cola that's  sitting beside her.   She takes a final swig, then tosses the can in the waste  basket, where it joins a number of other empties. Kristen rummages through the drawer in her nightstand, an grabs some cigarettes and matches.  She gets out of bed,  crosses to the window, and slides it open. She slumps into the chair beside the window, and lights a match by striking it against her thumbnail.  Very cool. lights the cigarette and takes a deep drag.
Alice can be seen by the kitchen window.  A sliver of lig creeps out of the garage, along with a THUMPING NOISE.
Rick is involved in a series of interesting exercises.  H kicking and sparring with a suspended bodybag, doing mart arts spins between returns.  He wears an oriental bandana around his forehead.
Alice is standing at the sink in front of the kitchen win finishing up a stack of dishes.  She looks up when headli sweep across her face.
A car is swerving into the driveway. It makes an awkward  approach, and knocks over a garbage can that's positioned well off to one side.

Rick stops his exercises and steps away from the opening  electric door.  The car jerks into the garage, and Johnso climbs out.  As he walks uneasily to the house, he takes quick nip from the bottle he's brought home.  Johnson bec self conscious when he sees his sone watching him.
First one of the day, scout's honor. He shuffles by Rick.
Johnson comes in and crosses to Alice.  Rick follows as f as the doorway but holds his position there.
I'm late, I know, damn contracts...Let's  eat.
We waited a long time.
But we gave up.  As usual. Alice takes a salad bowl out of the fridge and places it front of her father as he sits down at the table.  Johnso stares at the salad in disbelief.
(disgusted)
You call this vegetation a meal after a  ten hour work day?  What the hell am I?   A rabbit?  Christ, Alice, can't you try  to think a little more?!
Begin daydream.  Alice suddenly SMASHES the salad off the table.  She turns angrily on her father.
Yeah, I can think!  I can think of how  sick I am watching you drink your life  away and taking it out on me!
End daydream.  Alice's father is staring at her.  The sal is back on the table.  All is as it was.
Do I speak in foreign tongues?  Alice,  I'm talking to you.  Are you awake or  what? Alice doesn't answer.
Dad, don't start.
Start what?  Telling the little  daydreamer to wake up?  It's long  overdue. Johnson gets up and heads out. JOHNSON (cont'd)
Hell with this.   JOHNSON (cont'd)
Aggravation  I don't need.
Alice stands before a mirror that is virtually covered wi photos.  She seems lost in though and doesn't see Rick st into the room.
Don't you think it kind of defeats the  purpose?
What?
The mirror.  You can't see yourself in  it.

I don't want to. Alice takes a picture from the mirror, an old black and w of two little children, herself and Rick much younger wit woman.  A picture of happier times.  Crossing to sit on h bed... ALICE (cont'd)
Do you ever wonder how things would be if  Mom were alive?
(teasing)
Yeah.  She'd be half as strict as you.
But she wouldn't let Dad treat me like  that.
Look, you gotta stand up for yourself.   Learn to fight back. Rick does a spin and karate kicks high into the air. RICK (cont'd)
It's all in here. (tapping his head)
See yourself fighting.  And your body  obeys. Kicking high again. RICK (cont'd)
Come here. He pulls her up.
Rick...I can't.

Never say can't.  Just do what I do. He spins, stops.  She spins - sort of.  He kicks.  She ki Suddenly her shoe flies off, she hits the floor as her sh lands in the fish tank.  They both die laughing. RICK (cont'd)
Alice-son, you must have balance!
Establishing shot of house.

Posters of rock groups and girls line the walls.  The cam pans them slowly, tilting down past a particularly  provocative poster of a sexy bikinied babe.  CAMERA reach the LED display of a stereo's VU meter, which is hitting the red peaks.  But we can barely hear any music. The CAMERA FOLLOWS a headphone cord away from the stereo, passes some gorgeous pin-up POSTERS on the wall, and then finally reveals Joey stretched out on his waterbed.  He h his TV hooked up to his stereo and is watching MTV, which HEARS through the headphones. They're rocking out to a tune that spills out of his  headphones.  He's also flipping through the latest issue Rolling Stone.  His eyes slowly shut. The magazine drops to his chest. ALL AT ONCE, a rocking motion starts to make Joey rock ba and forth.  Something is causing waves within the waterbe Joey snaps to.  He notices that the girl in the slutty po has vanished, leaving only her photographed background. has no time to be puzzled, however as he rolls over and p back the sheets on the bed... To Joey's surprise and delight, a beautiful NAKED GIRL is staring up at him from INSIDE HIS WATERBED. Not just any girl, but the GIRL FROM THE POSTER.  Her hai floating around her face, and she's pressing her body up  against the inside of the clear plastic.  Her voice can't heard, but it looks like she's mouthing Joey's name.

What a great bed!! Entranced, Joey spreads his arms out over the girl and ti to hug her.  He's in heaven.  She starts to slowly drift from him, DROPPING DOWN into the water until her features no longer clear. SUDDENLY, the swimming figure bobs back up to the surface the bed.  But it's no longer a beautiful girl.  IT'S FRED Our old pal smiles up at Joey and the blades of his knive push against the surface of the vinyl mattress. Joey cries out, but before he has time to react, Freddy's arms rip up through the plastic and grab a hold of the bo As water gushes all over, Freddy's demonic face pops up  behind him.
How's this for a wet dream?
Noooo!!!!  Kristen!  Help! Freddy pulls Joey back down beneath the surface of the be and holds him under.  Joey thrashes, but its hopeless.
Two down.  One to go.  Hahahaha! CAMERA moves back around the room to the LED meter, watch as it dies down to nothing.
Kristen is sitting on her window seat, finishing off anot cigarette.  She blows smoke out the window, then uses the butt to light a fresh cigarette.
Joey's MOTHER comes in to say goodnight.
Joey, are you asleep already?  Joey? She gets to the bed.  MOM (cont'd)

C'mon, give your mother a kiss. She pulls down the covers to reveal Joey in the bed.  She screams. Joey is floating motionless INSIDE THE WATERBED.  His fac pressed up against the unbroken vinyl surface, his hair i billowing back in the still-swirling current, and his eye are open in an eerie death stare.

A gentle breeze is blowing in the window and Kristen clos her eyes for a few seconds as she lets the fresh air wash across her tired face. Suddenly the wind dies away and the soft sound of the  tinkling chime ABRUPTLY STOPS.  Kristen opens her eyes an stares out the window.  The night air is absolutely still The leaves have stopped fluttering and the wind chime han motionless in the tree. She hears someone calling her, so she gets up and goes ou

Kristen comes out and starts to walk slowly away from the door.  She is listening to the FAINT SOUND that is waftin through the air, but she isn't really sure just what it i As Kristen steps away from the house, the CAMERA MOVES wi her in a CONTINUOUS SHOT. So when she turns and heads bac the CAMERA is still following her.  And what Kristen sees makes her scream.
Her home is now gone.  Standing in its place is the decay ELM STREET HOUSE. Kristen spins around.

location: WEIRD THIN SPACE BETWEEN WALLS WITH CHAIN CURTAIN

text: She's in a long, weird, thin space between the walls.  Sh passes through a chain curtain and moves further in, the  corridor is filled with WAILING and STRANGE SOUNDS.

location: WEIRD THIN SPACE BETWEEN WALLS WITH CHAIN CURTAIN

text: Kristen tries to navigate through the thin space.  She  SCREAMS and starts running as arms begin bursting out of sides of the corridor.  She ducks as they grab for her. No offense, or anything, but it's kind of  hard to swallow.
The story is, the deaths you can't argue  with. Alice's eyes well up.  She begins to come unraveled. ALICE (cont'd)
I don't know what to do.  I can't stop  it.  Why doesn't he just kill me?
How long have you been awake?
Three days. Dan lets this sink in.  Alice becomes embarrassed and sel conscious under Dan's scrutiny. ALICE (cont'd)
Don't you understand?  Every time I  sleep, someone might die.
Alright, let's assume this whole thing is  true. Why does Freddy all of a sudden  need you?

Kristen was the last child left of the  people who killed Freddy.  Maybe Freddy  can't get to new kids without someone  like me.  Someone to bring them to him. Dan and Alice are both silent for a moment.  They look at each other.  Dan reads the mix of emotions on Alice's fac guilt, shame, anger, exhaustion.  He's about to say somet when a sudden voice calls out.  Dan's date, a pretty and  polished CHEERLEADER TYPE, appears at the door.
Danny, we're going to be late for the  drive-in! Dan is embarrassed, so is Alice, who's also jealous.
I have to get back. Alice hurries off to the kitchen as Dan watches in  frustration.
Dan and a BUDDY are suiting up for practice.
Ninety-three days until summer.
What's the matter man, getting tired?

No, I'm getting worried.  Let's see if we  survive until summer.  It's been open  season this semester.  Pretty weird  stuff. Dan and his buddy spot Rick entering and sit down on one the benches. BUDDY (cont'd)
Speaking of weird, you gotta feel for  that guy.  Dead girlfriend and a basket  case sister. Dan angrily reacts to this.  He shoves the buddy up again the lockers.
Hey!  Learn to shut up, asshole! Dan heads for Rick.  He sits down next to him. DAN (cont'd)
You look wasted.
Been up with Alice.
How she doing?  I ran into her last  night.
She's blaming herself for Sheila.  I know  how it feels.  I've been thinking about  Kristen.  Maybe I could've stopped it, if  I'd listened.
About Freddy?

What else?  You ever look over this  town's history?  Not a safe place to be a  teenager.  Anyway, if I'm next, watch  your back. Dan smiles at the gallows humor. The coach bellows into the locker room.
Hey you bozos, up and out!  NOW!! As Dan and the other boys head out to PE class, Rick deto to...
Rick heads to a stall.

Alice is struggling to stay awake in a back row of the cl At the front, a typical high school lecturer drones on in boring monotone. We hear the words from Alice's point of view as they dist as she gets closer and closer to falling asleep.

Every society, dating back to the  ancients, has had theories regarding  dreams, what they mean, how to control  them.  Aristotle believed that during  sleep you soul roams free.  What it sees  are dreams.  Skilled dreamers control  what they see.  There is a theory that  there are two gates your soul can enter,  one a positive gate, the other a  negative.  The dreammaster guards the  positive gate and protects its sleeping  host.  There are fewer theories about the  negative gate...

Rick sits on the toilet. He looks up in surprise when the door begins to rattle.  A bunch of girls in cheerleading  costume suddenly barge in.  They look down at Rick and la as he struggles to pull up his trousers. Suddenly the room begins to shake.  Rick looks around and sees the room transform into an elevator.  Buttons push o of the walls and the doors change.

One of the girls pushes button #13.  The elevator shoots Rick is astonished.  The doors open and the girls shove o Rick can see Alice among the girls.  She is pushing forwa trying to go help him.  She disappears in the crowd.  Ric looks around at:
Rick looks ahead into the hellish bathroom.  In front of he sees the familiar back of Kristen.  She leans over the sink, looking in the mirror.  The mirror image speaks to
C'mon, Rick.  Make me laugh. Rick steps forward to go to Kristen.  She turns, revealin her face is a burned horrific mess.  Kristen laughs evill Rick reels back into the elevator.

The doors slam shut in Rick's face.  Suddenly the elevato rocketed downward.  Rick holds on for his life.  The butt sequence faster and faster until they are a blurry glow. Through the elevator speaker comes Freddy's voice.

Going down.  Women's wear, lingerie,  cutlery, butcher knives.  China... The elevator comes to sudden halt, Rick is thrown to the  ground by the impact.  He gets up and looks around as the door opens into:

A pristine clean Chinese room (a la living quarters in  Chinese Ghost Story) - tatami mattes, white and colored  screens, open, light and airy.  Rick steps out tentativel He scans the room suspiciously, then more calmly. Suddenly, out of nowhere, Rick is hurtled backward as if  kicked by an invisible opponent.
What the... Freddy's voice is heard.
A true warrior, Rick-san, needs no eyes. Rick is kicked again and floored.  He stands, now angry. flails around at the air, then is hit again.
Come out and fight me, you chicken shit. Freddy's laugh is heard.

Ninja warriors have calm.  Find your  balance, Rick. Rick is hit again and thrown back against a screen which  breaks.  He stands up slowly, with ultimate concentration turns quickly as if with radar. Suddenly he kicks back at air and connects.  A resounding thump is heard.  He  progresses forward in a series of karate moves all of whi connect soundly and quickly with the invisible force.

Too wimpy to show yourself, Krueger?   Well, how's this for balance? With extra strength, Rick kicks out in the air.  He conne hard and suddenly Freddy's glove appears out of thin air lands on the floor as if kicked off by Rick's power. Rick stops and stares at the glove on the ground.  He lau victoriously. RICK (cont'd)

Hahaha.  You superhero.  How you gonna  get me without your weapon?  You're dead  meat. Rick looks down as Freddy's laugh resounds through the ro Suddenly the glove jumps up in the air and goes straight Rick, reaming him in the stomach.  Rick falls over - dead
Hari-kari to you and your balance, boy.   Sayonara, Rick-san.

Alice wakes up with a jolt.  She's HIT by an incredible f and her entire seat shakes off its bolts.  Students next her back away. She SMASHES her desk top with her fist, sending bits of w and metal flying.  She lets out a soul-crushing CRY.
Nooooo!!!! The windows in the hall SHATTER.  Alice runs out of the h
The coach ENTERS the room and calls out.
Hey, Johnson!  Let's go!! THE CAMERA TRACKS past the Coach to the empty stalls,  stopping as we see Rick's twisted hand lifeless on the ti floor.
Dan is walking by a series of graves.  They bear the name

head_text.subj: NANCY THOMPSON, DONALD THOMPSON, ROLAND KINCAID, JOSEPH

text: PETERSON and finally, KRISTEN PARKER. Dan stands before the graves of Freddy's victims.  A wind RUSTLES the leaves in the trees above his head.
And then there were none.

Yet another funeral is taking place in Springwood.  Mourn gather around the grave site.  Johnson stands before the  grave, disheveled, unshaven, a wreck.  There are a few te classmates of Rick. Alice and Debbie stand off to the side.  Alice is clutchi Rick's oriental bandana tightly in one hand.  Debbie is  sobbing softly.  Alice is cold blue steel.  She's wearing Rick's dark sunglasses.

Begin Daydream.  Rick hops out of his coffin with athleti ease.  He's dressed in his best suit.  He looks very happ He strolls over to Alice, who takes off her sunglasses an stares at him.  No one else notices.
Great goof, huh?  They think I'm dead.  I  love it! Alice starts to gently cry.  Rick reaches out and wipes a tear away. RICK (cont'd)
Hey, you know I wouldn't leave you all  alone.  This was just to fool Freddy.   I'm here. Alice stares at him, longingly.  Finally she shakes her h 'no'.
Alice...Alice? The sound of Dan's VOICE BREAKS THE DAYDREAM.  Alice blin twice before she realizes that Dan is really talking to h DAN (cont'd)
Are you okay?
Not really.
Is there something we can do?
I don't think so.  I guess this is my own  war.
No it isn't.  We all gotta survive. She pumps up. DEBBIE (cont'd)
I don't spend hours working out to let  some damn nightstalker beat me.
You don't really get it.  He's not a  nightstalker.  It'll take more than bench  presses to beat him.
Why can't we just talk to the  authorities?
Yeah, right.  Let's trade death by Freddy  for life in a rubber room.  Adults won't  see it. They can't.
Then what else can we do?
Try what other kids did.  Keep each other  awake.  We'll meet at Debbie's tonight.   At least if we don't sleep he can't get  us.
Who?
I know just the guy. Dan shrugs and leaves with her.

Alice hangs Rick's oriental bandana on the mirror, next t Sheila's gadget.  She places Debbie's studded bracelet on vanity table.  Alice looks at herself in the mirror.   Something catches her eye. She takes another picture off the mirror's surface.  It's picture of her and Rick.  She looks up, she can see more herself.  She's quite beautiful now, and there's a surety strength in her eyes.  She stares at her reflection. She's brought Rick's nun-chucks up from the garage.  She  begins to go through some moves with them.  Slowly at fir she builds to a blinding speed.  She watches herself in t mirror. Alice GASPS and drops the sticks.  She walks to the mirro and places a hand on it.
(scared)
What's happening to me?
Johnson is slumped in a chair watching a soundless TV.  A Alice ENTERS, dressed to leave, he rises to stop her.
No, you're not leaving this house. He stands in front of her, slightly menacing.
Get out of my way you pathetic lush.
Honey, I may be a drunk, but I want you  here.  We're all we have... Alice softens.
Dad, please... Johnson lapses into a drunken monologue.

Nope, gonna watch you, didn't watch him,  lost him, won't lose you...you're stayin'  in... Alice waits a moment, then reaches out and puts a hand on father's face. She holds it there a second. JOHNSON (cont'd)
You're becoming beautiful, I never  noticed before... Johnson clumsily backs up and pours another drink. Alice  heads back upstairs.
Dan waits for Alice, he's leaning up against a street lam
All the towns in America, I had to move  to the Bermuda triangle.
The room has been outfitted to serve as her gym.  It is  equipped with free weights, and a weight bench. Debbie greets, dressed in sweats, yawns.  Looks at her wa She looks tired.
Alice is seated on her bed, she's staring at her mirror. gets up and crosses to the window.  She opens it and clim out.
Alice climbs out of the window and maneuvers down to the  street in a duplication of the moves we saw earlier from  Rick.
Alice reaches Dan's corner, he's gone.  She looks around, one in sight.  Frustrated, she walks off and turns a corn

Alice turns the corner and in an abrupt, sudden change of setting she finds herself in the middle of a run down, se urban street. It's empty, just blackened store fronts.  Alice spies the glowing marquee of a movie theater at the end of the stre
Alice reaches the B.O.  She takes a ticket from the atten and wanders in.

Alice takes a seat in the fifth row.  She has a box of  popcorn and a soda.  There are other patrons scattered ab the balcony.  We can't see their faces. Alice settles in.  She starts to watch the movie.  She sc a mouthful of popcorn.
Stoned patrons campily cavort and dance to the diner's  jukebox in a scene from REEFER MADNESS.
Alice sips her drink, adjusts herself.  Something about t film is making her uncomfortable.

But it's not as we know it from earlier scenes.  It's the CRAVE-INN of the future.  A beaten-down forgotten mutt of place.  All peeling paint and flapping canvas awning. We watch as the lights in the diner SWITCH ON and a wind  kicks up, blowing tumbleweeds and newspapers across the f of the diner. Suddenly, the front doors are blown off their hinges and picks up.  It whistles as the air becomes thick with dust debris.
As the wind whips over Alice, her popcorn scatters like a white rain.  Her drink is pulled out of her hand by the  wind's force.
Now hurricanes speeds are pounding the diner, the wind  getting stronger and stronger as...

Alice is standing, fighting the wind that's pulling her t the edge of the balcony.  She tries to grab her seat, cla fingers ripping into seatbacks, only to slip away. Alice is lifted off her feet and sucked right over the  balcony by the wind. She just manages to grab the balcony's edge and hold on, swinging free, trying to crawl back up... The wind beating her back.
(screaming)
Noooooo! suddenly, one of Alice's shoes is pulled right off her fo and FLIES ACROSS THE AUDITORIUM into
As Alice's shoe hits the movie screen and PASSES THROUGH. see it roll across the floor of the diner.

The wind is stronger still and Alice is struggling to  maintain her grip on the balcony. The other patrons just sit in their seats, watching. Alice manages to hoist herself up just a bit in order to the faces of the others in the theater. They're all blank looking pasty-faced people with death-l visages. Alice SCREAMS as a gust of wind rips her from the balcony sends her FLYING ACROSS THE AUDITORIUM, passing through t movie screen.
Alice tumbles into the shot, landing in front of the dine exterior.  Wind and debris blow, boards fly off the struc as she struggles to her face.
Alice makes her way into the diner.  She looks back.  The movie screen is behind her and beyond it is the auditoriu
She sees her zombie-like theater PATRONS, their death-lik faces displaying emotionless vacuums as they clap.

Alice turns and looks around the diner.  It's in just as shape inside as it was out.  It may be open for business, there are no customers to be seen.  A single WAITRESS is  standing behind the barren counter. Alice walks across to the counter, and settles onto a sto The waitress steps over, and slides a tattered menu in fr of her.  Alice studies the woman for a moment.  Something about her is familiar.  It makes the girl uneasy. In her sixties, the waitress looks like she's worked ever day of her life.  Her hair is streaked with gray, and the are deep pockets under her eyes.  She seems to be the kin person whose life has passed her completely by.
What'll it be? Alice doesn't answer. WAITRESS (cont'd) (impatiently)

C'mon, honey.  I don't want to be here  forever. Alice notes the waitress' name badge: ALICE The waitress turns and heads down to the end of the count As the woman walks away, Alice swivels on her stool to wa her go. Alice is startled to discover that another PATRON is now  sitting next to her.  IT'S FREDDY.
If the food don't kill ya, the service  will, hahaha! The waitress brings over a piping hot pizza.  She places in front of Freddy.
It has large pepperonis, only they're not pepperonis, the faces.  Screaming miniature faces.  The faces of Kristen, Sheila and Rick.

Ahhhh!  The usual! Alice reacts in horror to the death-pizza.  The faces cry to her.  Their voices are high and squeaky, as you'd expe miniature voices to be.  The effect would be comical if i wasn't so torturous.
Free us, Alice!  Free us!! Freddy tears the Rick face off the pizza and pops it in h mouth.  Alice gets up to run but Freddy grabs her by the  throat.
I love SOUL FOOD!  Bring me more!! Alice tries not to, but a WHOOSH tells us that she's drag someone in.  Alice looks back towards the movie theater. It's gone.  What we see is Debbie's attic.
Debbie's attic.  Debbie is dozing on her weight bench.
Freddy CACKLES triumphantly.  He turns to Alice.
Your shift is over.
The sudden HONKING of a passing car HORN awakens Alice. sits for a moment in confusion before clearing her head. She rushes out, using the window as before.
Debbie opens her eyes.  She rubs them tiredly then looks  around and reaches for the bar bell.
Dan's waiting with his truck on the corner.  Alice comes  running up.
C'mon, we have to hurry.  I'm driving. She hops into the driver's seat and starts it up.  Dan ha time to object.  He hops in and they SCREECH off.

Debbie's working up a real sweat, pressing a good sized b bell.  Up and down, several repetitions.  She's listening a portable stereo, which is plugged into the wall. Her hands almost slip. But Debbie catches herself and continues to press.
Alice is driving like a demon.  Dan straps on the seatbel
He's going after Debbie, I gotta stop  him.
Hey, you're not alone.  We have to stop  him, I'm with you.
You just feel sorry for me.
Cut that shit out.  Maybe before, but not  now. I want to help you. I'm on your  side.
The truck barrels down the street, shaking with the speed
As long as your driving doesn't kill us.
It's okay, we're just about there.

As Debbie extends the weights we can SEE FREDDY KRUEGER'S REFLECTION in the steel barbells.  Debbie brings the weig down and up again and Freddy is gone. Debbie slips the barbell into the resting place so she ca catch her breath.  She cracks her knuckles.  Suddenly, we one of Freddy's claws out the stereo box. Debbie reacts with puzzlement.
Alice turns a corner, heading for the house.
Here we are.
The truck is about to pull into Debbie's driveway.  Befor can, we SMASH CUT TO:
Alice and Dan are right back where they started from.  Da waits by the truck, Alice runs up.
C'mon, we have to hurry.  I'm driving. Dan hops in and they take off.  They don't know they're  experiencing special Freddy-deja vu.

Debbie CRACKS the knuckles on the other hand and goes to the weight.  AS she reaches up, FREDDY'S HANDS are alread there. Freddy starts to force the bell down on Debbie's throat a she begins to struggle against it.
(straining)
I don't believe in you...

I believe in you... Straining hard to keep the weight from crushing her... Freddy laughs as he exerts more pressure and Debbie can o close her eyes and SCREAM in pain as her ELBOWS SNAP in t Cracked in half, bone tearing through the flesh and muscl FREDDY (cont'd) (laughing)
No pain, no gain!
Alice is driving like a lunatic.  All is as it was before
He's going after Debbie.  I gotta stop  him.

Debbie forces herself to her feet, broken arms hanging li at her side. Insect like claws emerge out of the breaks in her arms. human flesh flops to the floor.  She ducks as Freddy heav the barbell into the mirrors in the attic. He starts advancing on her, claws CLICKING. Debbie looks up to Freddy with a pathetic
Give me back my BODY!!!
Alice turns a corner, heading for a house.
Here we are...
Once again, as she's about to pull into Debbie's driveway suddenly SMASH CUT TO
Once again, Dan waits by his truck, Alice runs up.
C'mon, we have to hurry.  I'm driving. Dan hops in, as before.  They SCREECH OFF.
Debbie, now even more insect-like, runs toward a small do at the other side of the attic.
But the door SEEMS TO GROW LARGER AND LARGER the closer  Debbie gets to it! As we see Debbie, she's tiny.
Alice drives like a lunatic.
He's going after Debbie.  I gotta stop  him.
You know, I get the weirdest feeling  we've been through this before. Alice throws him a puzzled, confused look.  It may be daw on them.

The room is now a strange white space, flat and dull.  De tries to make her way across but her feet start sticking the gooey floor. Like the thickest glue. Debbie struggles to free herself, but as she pulls, she f over, her face sticking to the goo.  It RIPS her flesh to reveal an insect face.  A roach trapped.
For the third time, Alice is turning the corner headed  towards Debbie's driveway.
Here we are.
Something's wrong here.  It feels like...
Alice is about to pull in, then BAM, SMASH CUT TO:
You guessed it.  Dan waits as Alice comes running up.
(simultaneously)
C'mon, we have to hurry.  I'm driving. Alice stares at Dan.
Oh God, I'm still asleep.  He's got us  going in circles. They hop in and take off.
Debbie, now more roach than girl, sees another struggling roach in the corner.  Debbie painfully turns towards the  doorway and sees FREDDY'S HUGE EYE PEERING IN.
Debbie SCREAMS at the huge FREDDY eye.  Freddy stands,  laughing, a "roach motel" bug trap in his hand.
You can check in, but you can't check  out! Freddy crushes the trap with a disgusting sound.
Dan's pickup truck is racing along.
Alice is suddenly hit with a violent shock.
What the hell was that?
(barely whisper)

Debbie.  She's gone.  I've...collected  her, like the others. A sudden, blinding brightness hits the truck. There are a pair of incredibly bright headlights coming  straight at them.  The lights grow brighter still until t are impossibly bright.  They burn off to reveal.
Freddy standing defiantly in the middle of the road, laug maniacally at Dan's on-coming truck.
Alice SLAMS the gas to the floor, murder on her mind.
Alright, asleep or awake, I'm gonna punch  his ticket in.

In the dream, the truck bears down on Freddy, smoke drift off the tires. We see Alice sneer as the truck passes right through Fred and SMASHES into a void, an invisible brick wall. The truck's front end gets totaled. Bits of metal and gla fly through the air as the truck crumples, as if it has h solid stone.
Dan's truck is wrapped around a large tree. Axles and gri work twisted out of place. A spurt of red smears the insi windshield. Alice manages to force open her door and just step out of truck...
Oh Dan, I'm sorry.  GOD, I'M SORRY!!!

The doors swing open and two young PARAMEDICS lift Dan in on a stretcher.  His leg has been bandaged with gauze, bu it's bleeding badly.  His MOANING tells us he's conscious Alice climbs in and notices one of the paramedics filling hypo.  He checks it for air bubbles.
What's that do? The paramedic turns toward Dan.
Relaxes your boyfriend. Alice jerks the paramedic's arm away.
Put the needle down.
(sarcastic)
Sorry doctor, rules is rules. Alice smacks the hypo out of the paramedic's hands.  It  SHATTERS against the wall of the ambulance.
(pure Dirty Harry)
He stays awake, those are my rules,  understand? The paramedic backs off a bit.  He looks at Alice with  suspicion.  Alice relents a bit. ALICE (cont'd)
He's allergic, okay?
Shoulda said so in the first place.
Alice leans in close to Dan, brushes his hair back with h fingers.
(whispers)
Don't let them put you to sleep.

An intern and a nurse are trying to put Dan to sleep, but he's fighting them back. At least making it difficult. Alice stands by watching as THE DOCTOR, JOHNSON and DAN'S PARENTS run into the ER.  Alice charges the doctor.
When do you operate? When does he hit  surgery?

From the looks of him, probably 15  minutes. The doctor turns his attention to Dan, who's strapped to gurney.  They start to wheel him away. Alice checks her watch.  It's a quarter to 10.  She has 1 minutes before Dan is forced to sleep. Alice starts after Dan, but Johnson grabs her by the arms holds her back.
Let it be, Alice.  They'll help him. Johnson reaches in his pocket for his car keys.
They're gonna kill him. Alice snatches the keys from her father and runs for the  swinging EXIT doors.
Alice, dammit, get back here.

Alice jumps in her father's car and cranks it over; burni rubber to back out of the parking lot. Alice drops the car in gear and takes off at top speed, b she SIDESWIPES ANOTHER CAR which is parked next to her.   Sparks, metal against metal. Alice BLASTS through the hospital lift-gate before SKIDDI into traffic and screaming away into the darkness.
Dan is being wheeled on a gurney.  He's struggling to sta awake.
Alice barrels through a light and fishtails around a corn
Alice grips the wheel.  The speedometer is straining. She looks at the dashboard clock.
Eight minutes to 10.  She has eight minutes left to do  something.
A NURSE and an ORDERLY lift Dan onto the operating table. The room is being quickly prepped; checking instruments. Doctors scrubbing up. Activity all around.
Alice SCREECHES to a halt in front of her house. She burs out of the car and runs into the house.
As the nurses lay out the instruments, Dan is still grogg The operating room clock tells us Alice has 5 minutes lef
As Alice runs through, she passes a gun rack mounted on t wall.  She doubles back to it.  She regards it.
Couldn't hurt. She opens it and grabs a mean looking mother of a pump- shotgun and a box of shells.
We see the oxygen and anesthesia hoses put into place and gauges register pressure. The ANESTHESIOLOGIST preps the mask for Dan's face.  Dan  watches, protesting weakly.
I'll take the pain...no gas...no  gas...have to stay up. He fades out.

Alice throws the gun and the shells on the bed.  She open bottle of sleeping pills and pops more than enough for a on Freddy express. She starts to load the gun, inserting each shell with vic precision.  She cocks it.

This ends.  Now. She walks over to the mirror on the vanity table.  Her ey travel over the tokens she's collected form her friends. She starts to power up.  She takes Sheila's gadget, which she's improved, and hangs it around her neck.  She takes  Debbie's studded bracelet and SNAPS it around her wrist. Lastly, she takes Rick's oriental bandana and ties it lik Amazonian around her forearm.  She hoists the gun.  She l her reflection in the mirror.  Something's very different The pills are starting to take effect.  Alice grabs her  forehead. She looks back at the mirror.  She's strong, confidant, r to accept her destiny.  With forceful determination, she tears the rest of the  pictures off her mirror.  What she sees makes her GASP.

It's Alice alright, but everything's turbo-charged.  She' leaner, meaner, her clothes are tighter, more battle-like Everything's accented.  The gadget around her neck is now super high-tech amulet.  The bracelet has spikes instead studs and seems to be made of shining titanium. This is no high school girl.  This is no dream warrior. is the dream master, ancient guardian of the gate of good dreams.  Alice speaks to her reflection.
Now I lay me down to sleep. The reflection speaks back.
The master of dreams, my soul I'll keep.
In the reflection of my mind's eye.
Evil sees itself and it shall DIE!!!
Fuckin' A. Alice looks at the shotgun, which remains the same in the reflection.  Next to her supernatural image, it doesn't s an impressive weapon. ALICE (cont'd)
Save it for Rambo. She tosses the gun aside and notices the clock on her van table.  It's 15 seconds to ten.
Suddenly, Dan starts to choke He opens his eyes and sees the doctor standing over him. It's FREDDY in surgical greens, razor-fingers at the read Dan pulls the mask from his face and cries out.
Freddy!!!
It ain't Dr. Seuss! Hahahaha!
No, Alice!  Alice!!!
Alice HEARS Dan's distant cry.
Alice!!! The reflection of the Alice as the dream master has been  replaced by the image of the operating room.  Alice can s Freddy menacing Dan.
(screaming)
Get away from him you SONOFABITCH!!! Alice goes diving headfirst into the mirror.  It sucks he in.

Alice rolls onto the floor.  She now has the image of the DREAM MASTER from her mirror, complete with all the regal She's one pissed superhero. She looks around. Freddy's gone. Alice helps Dan off the table, since we're in the dream, injury is healed.  He gets an eyeful of Alice's spectacul new appearance.
(astonished)
You look great!

Save it for later.  Come on! Alice and Dan turn around and run for the doors.  Just as they get to them, Freddy throws them open from the other  side. On instinct, Dan leaps in front of Alice to confront Fred He grabs Dan's fist, holds his arms out and slashes Dan.  Once, twice, across the chest.  Blood spurts but it's onl superficial damage. Alice grabs the sharper of the the surgical instruments a turns on Freddy. ALICE (cont'd)

I'll mail your guts back to hell!!! Alice starts to hurl the instruments at Freddy Kung Fu st with blurring speed and accuracy.  Rick would be proud. Alice nails Freddy once, a dozen times in the space of a seconds.  Freddy doubles over, sharp instruments sticking of every part of him.  Alice advances on him and delivers massive, sharp kick to Freddy's balls.  Freddy makes a SO that banshees would flee from. Alice grabs Dan and the two plunge through the doors.

Dan and Alice run into the hallway.  But it's no hallway, it's a huge, rotating cylinder.  It looks like a hallway, it's spinning.  Dan and Alice immediately become dizzy. At the end of the hallway, there's a large, wall-to-wall  sheet of colorful lights.  It gives the impression that D and Alice are trapped within a huge kaleidoscope. They careen down the hallway and go crashing through the  colorful lights, which turn out to be stained glass. Dan and Alice CRASH through a stained glass window withou the gurney and land with such tremendous force that even  after hitting the floor they don't stop.  They skid along floor, out of control. Keeping Dan's hand in one hand, Alice reaches out and SLA her spiked bracelet into the floor.  The spikes dig in an serve as her break.  They SCREECH across the floor, smoke rises from the grooves they make.  Alice digs in deeper a they manage to come to a stop in a pile of broken stained glass. They stand up, just as Freddy appears.
Welcome to wonderland, Alice!  Hahahaha! Dan leaps at Freddy.  Freddy slashes him across the chest superficially, but there's plenty of blood.
Nooo!!!
The doctors are working on Dan.  Suddenly, blood starts t spurt wildly from his chest.
Christ, he's hemorrhaging badly!  Close  it off and bring him out of it!  Hurry!
